title: Dual overlaps and finite coupling 't Hooft loops
abstract:
Integrable $su(2\vert2)_{c}$ symmetric models have integrable boundaries with
$osp(2\vert2)$ symmetries, which can be embedded into $su(2\vert2)_{c}$ in two
different ways. We dualize the previously obtained asymptotic overlap formulas
for one of the embeddings to describe the other embedding and apply the results
to describe the asymptotic expectation values of local operators in the
presence of a 't Hooft line in N=4 SYM. A peculiar feature of the setting is
that in certain gradings only descendant states have non-vanishing overlaps
with the boundary state and the overlap formula is not factorized for the Bethe
roots.
